VI it looks like the second line of ScrolledComposite.layout(boolean) should 
check for disposed content in addition to null?

Prior to 3.0, it was up to the application to set the content control to null 
before disposing of it.  This was true for all widgets with controls added 
using setControl (e.g. TabFolder, CTabFolder, CoolBar, ToolBar, 
ViewForm, ...).  Prior to 3.0, the Widget is disposed fault lies with the 
application code.

However, I see that Steve has added parent.removeControl calls for the widgets 
in 3.0.  I will have to discuss with Steve why this change in design was made 
and then make all custom widgets compliant.

Discussed this with Steve.  We are going to stick with our previous position 
on this for Custom widgets.  You must set the control to null before you 
dispose of it otherwise you will get the "Widget is disposed" error.

Please enter a bug report against cz.bonicom.jaris.app to correct the way they 
use the custom widgets.
